common.name: Name
common.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the selected item?
common.userAddFailed: Failed to add the following users
common.userCodesRequired: Please provide valid {{uniIds}} separated with spaces!
common.noFilesSelected: Please select at least one file!
common.confirmDiscard: If you close the modal, all your changes will be lost!
common.confirmAddSemester: If you add a new semester, that will be the actual one and you won't be able to change back the previous one
common.cancelCanvasModalDesc: Are you sure you want to cancel the Canvas synchronization?

passwordProtected.studentWarning: The solution must be validated by the instructor, otherwise it will be invalid!
passwordProtected.unlockWarning: The task is password protected, please provide the password to unlock it!

passwordProtectedTest.studentWarning: The test must be unlocked before starting!

fileUpload.sizeLimitError: The total size of uploaded files is limited to {{maxSize}} MiB!
fileUpload.forceOverwrite: Overwrite existing files with same names

hint.atLeastOneDockerfile: Upload must contain a file named "Dockerfile"!
hint.dllExeNotAllowed: Uploading .dll and .exe files is not allowed!
hint.zipOnly: When uploading multiple zip files, the files are packed into a single zip!
hint.willBeZipped: The uploaded file(s) will be packed into a single zip file!

errorPage.versionError: The backend version does not meet with the required version range! Excepted range: {{requiredRange}}, current version: {{version}}.
errorPage.serverTimeDiff: The server time differs from the local time by {{diff}} minutes, so the application may not work properly. (To remove the message, set the correct time and reload the page)

aboutPage.description: TMS (Task Management System) is an open-source, web-based assingment management, automated evaluator, plagiarism detection and examination software for computer science higher education.
aboutPage.issueBoardText: If you encounter a bug, please report it on our Issue Board. Thank you for helping us improve!
aboutPage.changelogText: To see the latest updates and improvements, check out our changelogs:
aboutPage.creditsText: Our special thanks goes to all participant of the project! Discover the team on our Credits page.

login.ldapHelp: You can log in with your INF.ELTE.HU account. (The one used to login on ELTE FI faculty computers.)

customEmail.unconfirmed: Unconfirmed email address. Please confirm your custom email address before sending notifications there.

notificationTarget.label: Send notifications to
notificationTarget.noEmailToUnconfirmedAddress: Please confirm your custom email address before sending notifications there

confirmEmail.openSettings: You might now want to visit <settings>your settings</settings> to change the address used for notifications.
confirmEmail.logIn: You might now want to <login>log in</login> to change the address used for notifications.
confirmEmail.differentUser: Warning: The email address belongs to another user. To adjust your notification preferences, log out and log in with the user this address belongs to.
confirmEmail.failed: The email confirmation failed. Either you provided a wrong confirmation code, or the code has expired.

course.invalidCourseCodes: The maximum length of a course code is {{maxLength}} characters, the following codes are not valid: {{codes}}.

notification.dismissibleHelp: If checked, the notification can be dismissed by the user.

group.examGroupHelp: For exam groups the group number and the identity of the instructors and submission graders are confidential toward the students.

canvasSyncTooltip.part1: Only courses with a published state in Canvas will be synchronized.
canvasSyncTooltip.part2: Only assignments will be synchronized, quizzes not.
canvasSyncTooltip.part3: Only published assignments with an "Online" submission type, "File Uploads" entry type, and restricted extension type to "zip" will be synchronized.

syncLevels.nameLists: Only synchronize student and lecturer name lists

task.name: Name
task.structuralRequirementErrorMessageHelp: If no custom error message is provided, one containing the violated regular expression will be generated.
task.creator: Creator
task.personalDeadlineHelp: After setting a personal deadline, students can submit a new solution even after the hard deadline, assuming their last upload has not yet been graded or was rejected.
task.ipNoRoom: No room associated with this address
task.instructorFilesHelp: Files uploaded here will be accessible for students (once the task is available for them).
task.taskFilesHelp: Files uploaded here will be accessible for students (once the task is available for them).
task.structuralRequirementHelp: You can define regular expressions that will ensure a directory or a file either exists or does not exist in the uploaded solution. Example regular expressions: '\.cpp$' or '/bin/'.
task.exitPasswordHelp: For exit password-protected tasks the solutions must be verified after uploading. Leave the password field blank to turn off password protection. Important: after removing the password all solutions will be verified!
task.exitPasswordGitPush: For exit password-protected tasks the 'git push' command is disabled.
task.entryPasswordHelp: The details of entry password-protected tasks can only be viewed by the students after entering the specified password. The password only unlocks the task in the browser, where it was provided.
task.versionControlledHelp: Uses separate Git repositories for each student. Not modifiable after task is created!
task.emailNotificationHelp: Send an email notification to the students when changing the deadline.

evaluator.argumentsHelp: Passed as console arguments to the process.
evaluator.inputHelp: Passed through the standard input stream to the process.
evaluator.outputHelp: Expected content of the standard output stream. Starting and trailing whitespaces are not expected to match precisely.
evaluator.uploadDockerfileHelp: If you upload a Dockerfile, the application will ignore the value of the Docker Image filed. Notice that building an image from a Dockerfile can take up several minutes.
evaluator.runInstructionsHelp: Arguments of the test case are available in the "$@" variable. ($args in case of PowerShell.) The serial of the test case is stored in the $TEST_CASE_NR environment variable.
evaluator.runWebAppInstructionsHelp: Set up web application environment and start web application. The instructions will be executed in asynchronously.
evaluator.showFullErrorMsg: When checked students can see the detailed compile or runtime messages.
evaluator.reevaluate: Reevaluate already tested, but ungraded student submissions
evaluator.templateHelp: In case you are not familiar with the interface, it is recommended to start with a template. Please click on the Templates button and select one of the preconfigured templates.
evaluator.builtImageNotFound: The automatic evaluator only runs on tasks with successfully downloaded or built image.
evaluator.successfullyBuild: There is an image successfully built or downloaded for this task with creation date: {{createdAt}}
evaluator.failedBuild: Building an image from the Dockerfile was unsuccessful.
evaluator.inProgress: We are processing your request, please wait! If we need to download or build a new image, it may take some time.
evaluator.imageRequired: Please provide a Docker Image or upload a Dockerfile!
evaluator.previousSemesterInfo: Tester settings cannot be modified: the selected task belongs to a previous semester.
evaluator.notTested: The automatic tester has not tested your solution yet.
evaluator.testFilesHelp: Student solution will be loaded into the /test/submission/ folder, which will be the default working directory during compilation and testing. Test files are loaded into the /test/test_files/ folder. On Windows OS, the root folder will be C:\\test\ in an analog manner.
evaluator.webTestSuiteHelp: The file syntax will be validated on upload.
evaluator.testSuiteValidationFailed: Test suite validation failed, check validation_error.log
evaluator.webTestTemplateDesc: Tests can be created with Robot Framework. Download the test template file to begin writing your test cases. The file syntax will be validated on upload. The uploaded acceptance test suites will be executed in alphabetical order.
evaluator.uploadPriorUpdate: Docker image must be save before updating
evaluator.portHint: Exposed port of the webserver running in the Docker container
evaluator.testCaseUpload: You can import the list of test cases from XLSX and CSV files. Important: the existing test cases will be discarded after the import!
evaluator.codeCheckerToggles: Additional arguments of the CodeChecker check command
evaluator.codeCheckerTogglesHelp: The detailed documentation of the CodeChecker check command
evaluator.staticCodeAnalyzerInstructionsHelp: On Linux OS the output of the analyzer must be placed to /test/{{outputPathLinux}}, on Windows OS the output of the analyzer must be placed to C:\\test\{{outputPathWindows}} in an analog manner. It is also important that the instruction above must keep the original exit code of the analyzer which can be read from the '$?' variable on Linux (Bash), and from the '$LASTEXITCODE' variable  on Windows (PowerShell).
evaluator.codeCheckerSkipFileHelp: The list of the ignored source files can specified with the CodeChecker skipfile format.

detailedStatusMessages.noIssues: No issues were found in the uploaded submission
detailedStatusMessages.inProgress: The uploaded submission is being checked
detailedStatusMessages.analysisFailed: The static analyzer tool failed to run. The uploaded solution may be incorrect or the configuration for the task may be invalid.

evaluator.templateSelectConfirmDescription: Applying the selected template will override the current settings!

exec.autoTearDownAt: App will auto shut down at

git.taskLevelGitRepoNotAvailable: Task-level repository is not available, because this task has been created by an older version of TMS.
git.updateAfterStudentListChanged: Update the repository after the list of students has changed

task.canvasUpload: Visit the Canvas page of the assignment to upload a new solution!

ipDisallowed.title: Disallowed IP address
ipDisallowed.description: Viewing the task description or submitting a solution is not permitted, as your IP address is not whitelisted for this task.

status.statusHelp: For solutions that have been accepted, students are no longer able to upload new submissions. In the case of rejected submissions, resubmission is permitted if the deadline allows.

quizTests.shuffled: Shuffle questions and answers in test instances
quizTests.unique: Generate unique test instance per student
quizTests.noGroupCreated: A group must be created before creating a new test
quizTests.passwordProtectedHelp: For password-protected tests the test must be verified before starting. Leave the password field blank to turn off password protection.
quizTests.durationZeroHelp: By setting duration to 0 you can allow students to write the test for the entire time it is available.

plagiarism.tasksRequired: Please select at least one task!
plagiarism.studentsRequired: Please select at least two students!
plagiarism.noResults: You have not run a check on this request yet. Click on the ‘Run’ button!

basefiles.about: These files can be added to plagiarism checks as exempted files. For example, instructor-provided files can be exempted to avoid false alarms when students legitimately use them.

moss.name: Moss
moss.ignoreThresholdHelp: The maximum number of occurrences before it is ignored

jplag.name: JPlag
jplag.tuneHelp: Tunes the comparison sensitivity by adjusting the minimum token required to be counted as a matching section. A smaller number increases the sensitivity but might lead to more false-positives. The default depends on the detected language.
jplag.ignoreFilesHelp: Ignore files with the given names. It matches only the file names, without directory paths.
jplag.ignoreFilesError: File names cannot contain forward or backslashes.

codeCompass.compileInstructionsNeededPrefix: To get all CodeCompass features, you need to provide a bash script that installs all the required packages, and another one which builds the project. The scripts are executed on Ubuntu 20.04 operating system. The base image can be found on the
codeCompass.compileInstructionsNeededPostfix: site. By default the image with the runtime-sqlite tag is used.
codeCompass.starting: CodeCompass is currently starting, please wait!
codeCompass.successfulParsing: The compilation of the project was successful, you can access all possible CodeCompass features:
codeCompass.tooManyInstances: There are currently too many CodeCompass instances running, so we placed your request into a queue. As soon as the needed resources are available, we will start the server and will send an e-mail to the user requesting the instance.
codeCompass.unsuccessfulParsing: The compilation of the project was not fully successful, there may be some CodeCompass features not available:

ipRestriction.name: Name
ipRestriction.resetWarning: Note: Editing the Task will reset the previous IP restrictions selections. You need to select them again if you want to keep them.
ipRestriction.duplicateIpError: IP address and mask combination must be unique
